page.title: 13The Fire Station
page.content: The fire station was opened in 1962. There are twelve full-time firemen at the station and fifteen part-timers. The men were called to four hundred and eighty different fires in 1984,an average of nine each week. Apart from these genuine alarm calls they also received two hundred and eighty-two false alarms. The firemen consider this sort of joke to be very dangerous because they might be answering a false alarm when a real call comes in. During the day the men are busy training and keeping the equipment clean and ready for use. There are no firewomen at the Trowbridge station but there are many in this country.
